assessments.status_rationale: Today’s bullets include an NYT piece on U.S. immigration policy/politics, but no cited DHS/ICE/HSI public announcement of a single-day worksite/logistics enforcement operation with ≥250 arrests/detentions in one metro area.

No item references a USTR Federal Register notice imposing an additional tariff rate ≥10% on imports with stated annual value ≥$50B, nor any Reuters/Bloomberg-style quantified coverage of such a measure.
None of today’s bullets report a Moody’s/S&P/Fitch downgrade of a U.S. private student-loan ABS tranche citing bankruptcy discharge risk and/or higher-than-expected losses.
No evidence in the provided bullets that the European Commission has published a COM legislative proposal for an EU-level ≥€10B AI compute/grid enablement funding program.
The news bullets do not provide LME 3-month copper settlement data or indicate a settlement at/above $10,500/tonne.
No bullet reports AWS announcing a North America data-center power procurement deal totaling ≥1.0 GW (PPA, generation acquisition, or dedicated build agreement).
Today’s bullets do not include U.S. 10-year Treasury yield closes or mention a close at/under 3.50%.

A MarketWatch item discusses quantum computing and stocks broadly, but there is no clear report that IonQ, Rigetti, D-Wave, or Quantum Computing Inc. completed an underwritten public equity offering raising ≥$200M.

No earnings-call transcript excerpt is included, and none of the bullets indicate Microsoft/Amazon/Alphabet/Meta explicitly citing 'copper' as a supply constraint or cost driver for data-center/AI buildouts.
